definition: to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: This section describes the system configurations, and more in-depth information about the workload.
sentences.chinese: 本节描述系统配置，以及关于工作负载的深度信息。

sentences.english: A second phase generates the glue code and the system configuration code.
sentences.chinese: 第二个阶段是生成胶合代码以及系统配置代码。

sentences.english: Are you planning to incorporate small or large system configurations.
sentences.chinese: 您打算合并小型或大型系统配置吗？

sentences.english: Learn how we improved performance with upgrades and system configuration changes.
sentences.chinese: 了解我们如何通过升级和系统配置变更来改善性能。

sentences.english: This step typically involves replacing core system files or changing the system configuration.
sentences.chinese: 该步骤通常包括替换核心系统文件或更改系统配置。

sentences.english: The system configurations were selected based on a tradeoff between price and performance.
sentences.chinese: 系统配置是根据价格和性能之间的权衡进行选择的。

definition: state monopoly of purchasing and marketing
to put together an order and deliver it (i.e. 配貨|配货[pei4 huo4] and 送貨|送货[song4 huo4])/to deliver (goods)
fixed government purchase (esp of farm products)
informatization (the Information Age analog of industrialization)
to put together an order of goods
